articles.title: Sunderland rioters attack police office and set car alight
articles.description: Three officers were taken to hospital and eight people were arrested, Northumbria Police say.

articles.title: Paris Olympics: GB set new Games gold record, joy for France
articles.description: Great Britain continue their most successful start to a summer Olympics - reaching nine golds after seven days for the first time ever at the Games.

articles.title: Plea deal with accused 9/11 plotters revoked
articles.description: US defence secretary Lloyd Austin says he did not agree to deal and relieves officer overseeing court of authority.

articles.title: What pointers can Kamala Harris take from the state run by women?
articles.description: With no woman having served as president, the state run by women could offer pointers for a route to the White House.

articles.title: Haberman reveals why Trump attacked judge and his family in speech

articles.title: Chinese spy balloon was able to transmit information back to Beijing
articles.description: The Chinese spy balloon that transited the US earlier this year was able to capture imagery and collect some signals intelligence from US military sites, a source familiar with the matter tells CNN.

articles.title: Beijing promised to ‘fight back’ over Taiwan leader’s US visit. But this time it has more to lose
articles.description: An anticipated meeting between Taiwan’s President Tsai Ing-wen and US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy in California this week has sparked concerns of a repeat of the pressure campaign China launched last year when then-Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taipei.

articles.title: Biden-Harris administration backtracks, revokes plea deal for 9/11 terrorists
articles.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III revoked a plea agreement reached earlier this week with the accused mastermind of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and two alleged accomplices.

articles.title: SEAN HANNITY: Kamala, with the help of the state-run media mob, is trying to obscure her record
articles.description: Fox News host Sean Hannity takes a hit at Vice President Kamala Harris' record as the presidential election is 95 days away on "Hannity."

articles.title: Reigning Cy Young Award winner Blake Snell throws no-hitter
articles.description: In his first 201 starts, Blake Snell had never recorded all three outs of the eighth inning - in his 202nd on Friday, he pitched a no-hitter.

articles.title: JESSE WATTERS: Secret Service makes 'shocking admission' after Trump assassination attempt
articles.description: Fox News host Jesse Watters reacts to the U.S. Secret Service's first press conference since the assassination attempt on former President Trump.

articles.title: Iran Arrests Dozens in Search for Suspects in Killing of Hamas Leader
articles.description: Iran has begun a sweeping investigation into the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, with its intensity a sign of how damaging and shocking the security failure was.

articles.title: U.S. to Send More Combat Aircraft and Warships to Middle East, Officials Say
articles.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III directed the new deployments after speaking with his Israeli counterpart.

articles.title: Defense Secretary Revokes Plea Deal for Accused Sept. 11 Plotters
articles.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III assumed direct oversight of the case and effectively put the death penalty back on the table.

articles.title: Not One of Us: Trump Uses Old Tactic to Sow Suspicion About Harris
articles.description: Politicians have long cast their opponents as outsiders. But Donald J. Trump has taken the strategy to the next level against Kamala Harris.

articles.title: Iran Arrests Dozens in Search for Suspects in Killing of Hamas Leader
articles.description: Iran has begun a sweeping investigation into the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, with its intensity a sign of how damaging and shocking the security failure was.

articles.title: To Lam Confirmed as Vietnam’s Top Leader Until at Least 2026
articles.description: Mr. Lam had been filling the post of general secretary temporarily since the death of his predecessor in July. Now he is in position to consolidate power.

articles.title: Germany Grapples With ‘Difficult Decision’ in Prisoner Swap
articles.description: By releasing a convicted assassin, Germany played a critical role in securing the freedom of 16 people held in Russia. But the decision has raised questions about political influence in legal cases.

articles.title: Bombs Rain Down in Myanmar as Junta Evades Sanctions to Buy Jet Fuel
articles.description:
U Har San and his wife crawled under a table, and their daughter, eight months pregnant, hid under a bed.
Bombs rained down, he said, even though no rebel fighters were in their village.
One bomb killed the mother-to-be, Ma Zar Zar Win.
“She was our only daughter, and now our family line has been cut off,” Mr. Har San said.
The airstrikes have also taken a heavy toll on resistance fighters.

articles.title: Eight people arrested and three police injured in Sunderland after another night of disorder
articles.description: Overturned car set alight and beer barrels and stones thrown at police amid face-off with hundreds of demonstrators

articles.title: Plea deal for accused 9/11 plotters revoked by Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin
articles.description: US secretary of defense pulls rank and withdraws agreements for trio accused of involvement in 2001 terror attacks

articles.title: Paris 2024 Olympics day eight: athletics, rowing, men’s cycling road race and more – live
articles.description: Join our writers for the latest from Paris 2024, with action on the track, road, in the pool and much more

articles.title: US bolsters military presence in Middle East as threat of regional escalation intensifies
articles.description: Washington is bracing for Iran and its allies to respond to the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, which Tehran blames on Israel
